newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss hotel stays slip 0.3 pct in February yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Swiss hotel stays slip 0.3 pct in February yr/yr.

text.p: Overnight stays in Swiss hotels dipped 0.3 percent in February from the year-earlier month to 2.76 million guest-nights, the Federal Statistics Office said.
February 1996 had one more day than February 1997, it noted, saying this and a trend toward shorter stays caused the drop.
The total was 6.9 percent below the February average for the past five years and 7.8 percent below the 10-year average.
Guest-nights in the first two months of 1997 rose 0.6 percent to 5.07 million. Domestic guest stays were up two percent while demand from foreigners fell 0.6 percent.
